Objectifs du module: The main objective of this class is to review the different tools allowing to deal with economic decisions in an uncertain and dynamic environment. The theory will be presented and several applications will be given (insurance, finance, investment decisions, role of asymmetric information…). An emphasis will be given on the value of information and on the timing of the investment decisions. Outline of the class: I. Introduction II. Choice under uncertainty III. Demand and supply for insurance IV. Asymmetric information and information acquisition V. Intertemporal choices VI. Timing and flexibility of investment decisions Evaluation: Final written exam (2h, without document). The make-up exam will be an oral.
